Maria Malama runs the cat shelter completely by herself and set up this project after realising that there were no other places taking cats. Maria receives no government funding and relies totally on her own income and donations from the public. At the moment the shelter is based at her home  but her landlord is now selling the property and Maria has to move to new premises urgently. This is where we need you to PLEASE help Maria!    Maria’s Cathouse is the only hope many cats in Chania have of surviving. Maria now wants to build a permanent cat shelter  but she needs funds to build enclosures  quarantine areas and fencing to build a safe and secure home for the homeless cats of Chania.    Maria never says no to a cat in need and often steps in when no one else will. Maria is currently caring for approximately 100 cats and she helps to treat and neuter many more. The cats in her care are also re-homed  often abroad  and it is Maria’s aim to neuter as many cats as possible in Chania and provide veterinary treatment for others in need.    Many of the cats in Maria’s Cathouse were on the verge of death when Maria found them and many suffer from long term health conditions. In the photos you can see some of the cats in Maria’s care  cats that would have died without her intervention.    Please help Maria to help the cats of Chania. The situation is at crisis point with no state-sponsored neutering taking place. Maria is determined to transform the lives of Chania’s cats and our priority is to build a safe and secure permanent shelter. Please help us with this project! Every single donation  no matter how big or small  is greatly appreciated and every cent will go to building the cats' shelter.     You can follow our facebook page for updates on the fundraising campaign to build the shelter: www.facebook.com/mariascathouse    Thank you to the moon and back!    Love Maria and the cats x    p.s. for those of you wondering  Maria’s Cathouse is currently in the process of becoming a registered charity in Greece. We will update you on this! If you have any questions about Maria's Cathouse please message the facebook page.

Title: Help Darryl & Max
Story: My name is Lesley Baldwin and I live and work in Edinburgh.    I am friends with a homeless man  Darryl and his dog Max. They have recently become victims of some thugs who have beaten up Darryl and stabbed little Max. Thankfully Max is ok and will make a full recovery.    Every day they sit on Dundas Street outside Margiottas. Darryl does not ask for money but is always happy to chat to anyone who stops to talk to him. He does not drink and does not do drugs. Darryl has been homeless for 3 years and does not qualify for any benefits.    People have been great about helping out with food  drinks and clothes  which he really appreciates. Now through raising awareness we have a chance to make a real and permanent difference to their lives. If everyone who reads this just gives a little bit we can use it for rent on a flat so he can then go on to claim benefits and get himself back on his feet. Darryl wants to become self sufficient  so please give him a little hand up and donate what you feel you can.    Thank you for reading and helping a vulnerable friend.

Title: Help feed the vulnerable in London amid COVID-19
Story: Pear Drops emergency catering was set-up as a non-profit organisation in response to the Coronavirus crisis in London.     We provide daily freshly prepared nutritious meals to the vulnerable  elderly and homeless in west and central London.    The COVID-19 pandemic has left many people worried and isolated. As the pandemic goes on  more people are losing their jobs and struggling to cope financially. Homeless shelters and community centres are closed. Elderly people have been asked to self-isolate and loved ones are unable to visit. Many are finding it hard to access warm nutritious meals.    Pear Drops deliver over 2 000 meals per week to homeless  vulnerable and elderly in need.    www.peardrops.co.uk    WE NEED YOUR HELP:  We rely 100% on donations and volunteers to provide our service. We have experienced first-hand how the pandemic is impacting the most vulnerable in society and how Pear Drops meals are providing a vital service to their life. Your donations ensure we can continue providing meals to those in need. Please donate if you can and help share this message.     **********    WHAT WE DO:    - Homeless: We have set-up various locations in central London every day  where we offer warm meals  clothes and basic essentials to the homeless sleeping rough and deliver meals to people in temporary accommodation. We also drive around London and offer meals to those in need we come across on our routes. We also supply meals to homeless charities who deliver them to their communities.    - Elderly & vulnerable: We deliver meals to the elderly and vulnerable who are isolated during the crisis  every day. Some of them haven't had a warm meal in weeks and all are very grateful and looking forward to our meals.      **********    WHO WE ARE:    Set up by the Pear Tree Pub and A Love For Brands in Fulham and a group of local volunteers  Pear Drops emergency food delivery was created to help local communities in West and Central London cater for the elderly  vulnerable and homeless during the COVID-19 pandemic.     Each day we create freshly prepared nutritious meals from our kitchen at Holy Trinity Brompton  and a team of volunteers deliver them across West London.      **********    HOW YOU CAN HELP    Your support will help us prepare  package and deliver meals to the homeless and elderly in London.     100% of your donation will be spent on:    · Fresh ingredients to prepare the meals  · Packaging to deliver meals. Packaging is getting scarcer every day  which increases prices.   · Bowls/cutlery/etc. to serve meals at our homeless stations  · Equipment  · Stationary for printing menu & allergens    No funds will be used towards rent  rates or management of our kitchen.       **********    We want to raise £20K  to help us provide over 10 000 free meals.     Please donate what you can to help the vulnerable at risk as a result of this global crisis.     If you can't to donate  please help us share the message.     Thank you for your support!    The Pear Drops team    [email redacted].uk    [phone redacted] 5757

Title: SAVE A FAMILY FROM BECOMING HOMELESS
Location: Bristol, South West England, United Kingdom
Story: Hello   This fundraiser is for the mother of my wonderful nieces and nephews. I will call her sis   she is very prideful so I really appreciate her allowing me to do this for them.My sis and her family spent their Christmas in a hotel room. They have been there for three weeks but can no longer afford to fund this. They live in a privately rented property that is not fit for purpose. The property is riddled with damp  mold and now a leak in the kitchen. Environmental health placed the property in category 1  this means not fit or safe to live in. The landlord refuses to do anything as sis is behind with her rent.   Health My sis suffers with a degenerative disc disease. This affects her mobility  due to damaged nerves she suffers with chronic pain  she is awaiting spinal surgery. My youngest nephew is on CAMHS waiting list  he struggles with routine and social situations.   Current situation There are many people involved in this case  environmental health  local mp  schools  Gp's. This will all take time but sis needs help now. The schools have now stated kids will be doing online learning. This will be very difficult in a hotel room that they eat and sleep in. Initially the kids found this all very exciting but now missing their rooms and their things. I am concerned the only help that will be offered is temporary accommodation  this could mean uprooting the kids from all they know.   Fundraiser The fundraiser is to help with the deposit for a new property and first month rent. Help to pay off the existing landlord  storage fees and everyday living. The current environment with Covid has made it harder to get things done and I know everyone is struggling. All payments will go directly to my sis and page will be updated to keep you informed. We would appreciate anything you can give no matter how small  this will be a blessing to them. Many thanks in advance.

Title: Get Sy Benson, The Green Robin, back on his feet
Location: South Kirkby, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: I met Sy Benson tonight. He’s the most upbeat  positive  amazing man who’s life has literally turned upside down by a twist of fate. He has split with his partner and found himself homeless. With no means of fixing this quickly  he’s offering a gardening and handyman service whilst sleeping rough and wild camping. The good weather won’t last long and with nowhere to call home he will struggle to get a private let. Without clean clothes and electricity  work will dry up. This could happen to any of us so easily and just a small donation from a few people will make a huge difference. I’m hoping to raise enough to pay for a room in a shared house via air bnb and a deposit for Sy to get a home of his own. A short term air bnb let will give him means to live and earn and provide an address and a reference for a bank account and a new home. Anything over and above these needs will begiven directly to Sy to start his life. Thank you in advance for any amount. Victoria.

Title: Rise up for those displaced in Tigray
Story: We have an emergency request !     Since the war broke out in Tigray November 4th 2020  nearly 2.3 millions of Tigrayan civilians have been made homeless and displaced across Tigray region. With no food or shelter  many have to rely on locals or anyone who is able to give a helping hand. Unfortunately as these crisis are across Tigray  many are facing the same challenges and with limited resources to food  water and medical aid  not to mention living in a complete darkness  the situation is looking dire at this point!    The influx of displaced civilians over the weeks  have forced many to take shelters in empty and unfinished building sites  sleeping on concrete without any bedding or food.    Having to move from area to area where a lot of the shelling and bombing took place  it has resulted in thousands of displaced Tigaru civilians being forced into Mekelle as a result of the war. Although  many local residents are facing the same threats and struggles  they initially took it upon themselves to share the little food and resources they had  however  they themselves are now facing starvation.     Despite this fact  this dire situation has inspired and cultivated local hero's to come together using their combined efforts to help those who have been effected by the war. Whilst this a temporary resolution  they have managed to secure empty schools in Mekelle to temporarily safeguard civilians. They are still not able to accommodate them with basic necessities.     Currently there are over 10 000 people displaced in Mekelle in dire need of shelter and food.     This was brought to our attention through family members who reside in Mekele and without any potential aid reaching them  this opportunity is one we can't afford to pass on. Our people are facing starvation  living in constant fear  they are reminded daily of the shelling and bombing.     We the UK (TYN) diaspora have therefore created this gofundme to raise some funds to help with food supplies & bedding for now  as they are desperately needed at this time.       No donations is ever too small so please help and donate what you can!  Thank you      TYN
